intro: Batesimalva pulchella, commonly known as the beautiful mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a velvety texture, while its stems are covered in fine hairs. Batesimalva pulchella thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
